name: Services for the UnderServed (S:US) - Veteran's Services
service_details: In addition to serving veterans with the greatest barriers to independence and a full community embrace, we serve the needs of veterans at the highest risk of suicide due to: the effects of chronic homelessness and unemployment, untreated PTSD, and disconnection from their families and a variety of social supports.

name: City Bar Justice Center
hours: Mon-Thurs: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Fri: 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM; Closed daily 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM
service_details: The Legal Hotline is staffed by attorneys who assist low-income callers on a range of civil legal issues, including matrimonial and family law, housing law, domestic violence, bankruptcy, and debt collection and benefits. Our staff includes bilingual attorneys who speak English and Spanish, and we can accept calls in any language through interpreting services.

In addition to our main medical center in Brooklyn, we offer a number of services to our patients in several community-based outpatient clinics. For mental health, call (212) 686-7500 x4656.

name: Staten Island Community VA Clinic
service_details: The VA New York Harbor Healthcare System serves veterans from the Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, Staten Island and the surrounding 5 boroughs of New York. In addition to our main medical center in Brooklyn, we offer a number of services to our patients in several community-based outpatient clinics. For mental health, call (718) 836-660 x4165.

name: U.S. Small Business Administration Veterans Business Outreach Center
service_details: Federal Government

name: Bottomless Closets
service_details: Bottomless Closet works to reduce the barriers New York City women face in the search for employment as well as provide on-going support and education so they gain the tools to succeed in their professional lives.

name: Institute for Career Development
service_details: Disabled Veterans Only; ICD was founded to help wounded veterans of WWI reintegrate into their communities and return to work. Serving the needs of our nation's veterans has remained a consistent part of our history and mission.

name: Workforce Opportunity Services
service_details: Post 9-11 Veterans Only; Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) is a leading 501(c)(3) nonprofit committed to developing the skills of untapped talent from underserved and veteran communities through partnerships with organizations dedicated to diversifying their workforce.

hours: Mon and Thurs: 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM; Tues: 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM; Wed and Fri: 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM

American Corporate Partners (ACP)
service_details: ACP�s free Mentoring Program connects post-9/11 veterans (Prot�g�s) with corporate professionals (Mentors) for�customized mentorships. ACP assists veterans on their path towards fulfilling, long-term careers, whether the veteran is job searching or newly employed.

name: New York Regional Office Outbased at Manhattan VAMC, Office 1
service_details: This office can assist with applying for benefits, burial claim assistance, disability claim assistance, e-benefits registration assistance, family member claim assistance, and updated direct deposit information.

name: Edge4Vets
service_details: To succeed in business veterans need to translate their strengths from the military into tools for quality performance in the civilian workplace. The Edge4Vets program is here to guide you through the translation process with online training and workshop support. Get ready for a job that can lead to a career and the life you want.

name: Veterans in Residence - BunkerLabs
service_details: WeWork Veterans in Residence powered by Bunker Labs is a national initiative providing space, services, business mentorship, and community to help veteran and military family member entrepreneurs find their tribe and create their life�s work. As part of our broader effort to connect transitioning service members and veterans to economic opportunity, WeWork�s Veterans Hiring Initiative is a commitment to hire 1500 veterans over the next five years.

name: Black Veterans of Social Justice, Inc. (BVSJ)
service_details: We will provide program services to assist military personnel making a smooth transition from active duty to civilian life.� We are dedicated to servicing military personnel, veterans and their families in the areas of social readjustment, housing, employment, compensation, disability, substance abuse, medical treatment, Post Traumatic Stress Syndrome, family intervention, prison counseling and relocation into the community, legal advocacy, discharge up-grade and redress of grievances within and outside the military. We will provide counseling, benefits information and�"tender loving care and an listening ear"!

name: Veterans on Campus (VOC)
service_details: Veterans on Campus-NYC is a coalition of the City's colleges and universities, corporations, and the NYC Department of Veterans and Services. VOC prepared Veterans on Campus Welcome Packet to help veteran students become oriented to being a student veteran in NYC.

name: Disabled American Veteran (DAV) Local NYC Office
service_details: Your Local DAV National Service Officer (NSO) will help you file a claim and stick with you all through the process, because no veteran should have to go at it alone.

name: Disabled American Veterans Hospital Service Coordinator
service_details: DAV operates a fleet of vehicles around the country to provide free transportation to VA medical facilities for injured and ill veterans. For NYC, please call the phone number listed to speak with Mr. Vincent P. Moccla who will coordinate a ride if eligible.

name: HRA SNAP Center - Concourse S45
service_details: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (formerly known as "food stamps") provides food assistance for nearly 1.8 million low-income New Yorkers including families, the elderly and the disabled. The program helps families and individuals supplement the cost of their diet with nutritious foods.

service_details: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is the federal agency that oversees lawful immigration to the United States. We are a component of the Department of Homeland Security.�

name: NYC Department of Homeless (DHS) - Office of the Ombudsman
service_details: The Office is an independent and impartial unit whose mission is to support New York City's homeless population, assist them on their path to fairer access to essential resources, improve their quality of life while in shelter, and advocate for a meaningful role in the decision-making processes that affect their lives.

name: NYC Mayor�s Office for People with Disabilities (MOPD)

service_details: The Mayor's Office for People with Disabilities (MOPD) is the liaison between New York City government and the disability community.

name: NYC Department for the Aging (DFTA)
phone_number: Please call 311 to contact this location.
service_details: Our mission is to eliminate ageism and ensure the dignity and quality of life of diverse older adults. We also work to support caregivers through service, advocacy, and education.

name: Borden Avenue Veterans Residence (BAVR)
service_details: Homeless veterans in need of short-term housing continue from DHS intake/assessment shelters to the VSU, where they receive referrals to transitional housing at one of two veteran-specific facilities: the Borden Avenue Veterans Residence (BAVR), a 243-bed short-term housing facility for male and female veterans.

name: Porter Avenue Shelter
service_details: Homeless veterans in need of short-term housing continue from DHS intake/assessment shelters to the VSU, where they receive referrals to transitional housing at one of two veteran-specific facilities: the Porter Avenue site, an employment-focused facility offering services for 138 male veterans
